result.execSummary:
The defendant Roger P Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
No violent contact with the victim, M.S.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: Stayed - to be used at the Court's discretion by petition from probation agent.  If stay is lifted, huber release is granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger P Young

defendant.name: Young, Roger P
defendant.address: 103 N Hudson Avenue, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Roger P Young in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. Defendant questions if State would be willing to drop the probation. Atty Korb is not changing her offer.  Defendant is accepting the State's offer, ready to conclude matter today.  State amends charge to Misd. Disorderly Conduct w/o the domestic abuse enhancer, gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to amended charge.  Defendant stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended Ct. 1. Victim makes statement to the court.  Atty Korb makes sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Roger P Young in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for October 9, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
